stream_context.summary: Kaze live-mapped and textured parts of Course 13, an ice-themed castle level, while showcasing a major framerate boost from Sauraen’s new FBDX3 microcode and discussing pending tasks such as collision memory, outside-area assets and a forthcoming Course 1 demo.

development_findings.summary: Sauraen’s FBDX3 microcode was integrated, lifting performance to ~50 FPS and paving the way for a stable 60 FPS; the project is now limited by RSP speed rather than RDP fill-rate.
development_findings.quote: We got FBDX3 working correctly now… I'm pretty sure we can get this to stable 60 now.

development_findings.summary: Per-area draw-distance and improved object culling are planned to stabilise framerate further.
development_findings.quote: I have per area drawing distance later.

development_findings.summary: Course 13 currently exceeds collision-triangle memory; some geometry will be flagged untouchable until a proper collision map is authored.
development_findings.quote: We are running out of memory for collision triangles… for now, we're just gonna have to make stuff untouchable.

development_findings.summary: An ambient-light bug occurs near extra light sources in X2 emulator builds but not on hardware with X3; cause is still unknown.
development_findings.quote: When I get close to an additional light source, the ambient light just disappears… It works on X3, but the X2 version doesn't.

development_findings.summary: Zeina is building a small outside area for Course 13; it will host an 8-Red-Coin star and a hidden 8-bit entrance star.
development_findings.quote: Two stars are going to be related to the outside area.

development_findings.summary: The next public demo will focus solely on Course 1 to let players test the new camera, swimming and Mario controls.
development_findings.quote: I'm planning a demo of just Course 1, only the first level, so everyone can play with the new camera and the new Mario controls.

development_findings.summary: Current textures are placeholders; Kaze expects Biobak to perform a full visual pass once basic colour/emotion cues are in place.
development_findings.quote: Whatever I do is just kind of like a suggestion for Biobak and he's gonna make it look a lot better.

development_findings.summary: Only two of five planned Yoshi guns are implemented; three still require coding.
development_findings.quote: Yoshi guns already implemented? Two of them are, three of them are not.

development_findings.summary: Long-term video roadmap includes episodes on optimisation techniques, the Course 1 demo, a Banjo-Kazooie import and RSP vs memory traffic findings.
development_findings.quote: I'm planning to make a video about all the optimisations… then a video about the new demo for Course 1… then a video about the new demo for Banjo-Kazooie… maybe a video about how we were wrong about memory traffic.

development_findings.summary: Course 14 is planned as a craft-themed world and Course 15 as a space world.
development_findings.quote: The craft world is world 14. The space world is world 15.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prioritises the emotion a scene should evoke over conventional visual appeal, e.g., using dominant blues to feel ‘cold and mysterious’.
context_findings.quote: When I'm doing visuals, I don't really think about pleasure to look at… I think about emotions I want to invoke in the player.

context_findings.summary: He moved from Germany to Canada and prefers Canada for lower taxes and quality of life.
context_findings.quote: Well, it's a lot better than living in Germany.

context_findings.summary: With a new child, Kaze feels financial pressure and plans to produce more YouTube content even if it means ‘selling out’.
context_findings.quote: Now that I have a child, I need to make more money… I might have to sell out a little bit.

context_findings.summary: He jokes about sensational ‘drama’ tactics for YouTube views but says he doesn’t want to become a drama channel.
context_findings.quote: I really don't want to be one of those drama YouTubers, that sounds like the absolute worst.

context_findings.summary: Kaze relies on practical home solutions, e.g., asking Zeina to cut his hair to save money.
context_findings.quote: I'm not paying for a haircut. I'm making Zeina do it.

context_findings.summary: Upcoming parental visit will affect his streaming schedule.
context_findings.quote: My parents are gonna be coming to visit in two days so that's gonna keep me quite a bit busy.

context_findings.summary: The stream showed swings between excitement (performance gains) and frustration (UI glitches, ugly textures).
context_findings.quote: This is fucking hideous, oh my God.

biobak.summary: Will perform the final texture/visual polish pass once Kaze’s layout work is done.
biobak.quote: Whatever I do is just kind of like a suggestion for Biobak and he's gonna make it look a lot better.

zeina.summary: Currently creating assets for the outside area of Course 13, which will host two stars.
zeina.quote: We are planning on the outside area and Zeina is making it right now.

zeina.summary: Handles some personal tasks for Kaze, such as cutting his hair.
zeina.quote: Zeina haircut. I'm not paying for a haircut. I'm making Zeina do it.

key_stories.title: Microcode Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Integrating FBDX3 shifted performance from sub-optimal to near-60 FPS, changing the main bottleneck to RSP processing.
key_stories.challenge: Previous builds struggled to maintain high framerates and were thought to be RDP-limited.
key_stories.process: Kaze patched in Sauraen’s FBDX3 microcode, live-profiled the game, and experimented with culling distant actors.
key_stories.outcome: Course 13 now runs at ~50 FPS with confidence it can hit 60 FPS; future work will target RSP optimisation.
key_stories.key_quote: We got FBDX3 working correctly now… I'm pretty sure we can get this to stable 60.

key_stories.title: Collision Memory Squeeze
key_stories.summary: Course 13 exceeded the N64’s collision-triangle budget, blocking progress.
key_stories.challenge: The level could not allocate enough memory for collision data.
key_stories.process: Identified memory overrun; decided to mark some geometry as non-interactive until a dedicated collision map is built.
key_stories.outcome: Development continues with a temporary workaround; proper collision optimisation scheduled.
key_stories.key_quote: We are running out of memory for collision triangles… for now, we're just gonna have to make stuff untouchable.

key_stories.title: Designing the Outside Area
key_stories.summary: A new exterior zone will expand Course 13 with its own missions.
key_stories.challenge: The level lacked variety and space for planned stars.
key_stories.process: Zeina began modelling assets while Kaze defined objectives—an 8-Red-Coin mission and a secret 8-bit entrance.
key_stories.outcome: Clear content plan; asset creation in progress.
key_stories.key_quote: Two stars are going to be related to the outside area… The first one is we're just going to have 8 Red Coins in the outside area.

open_questions.context: After FBDX3, the game is RSP-bound despite existing memory optimisations.
questions: What concrete techniques will you apply to reduce RSP load?
Could parts of the engine be re-written to balance CPU and RSP work?
How will you measure success going forward?

open_questions.context: Ambient light vanishes near extra lights in X2 emulator builds, not on hardware with X3.
questions: Do you know the root cause of this discrepancy?
Is the fix likely to be in engine code or microcode?
Could this affect future levels with complex lighting?

open_questions.context: Course 13 currently exceeds collision memory; temporary untouchable geometry added.
questions: What is the target triangle budget and how close will the final map come to it?
Are new tooling or compression techniques being considered?
Could future levels face the same constraint?

open_questions.context: Zeina is building Course 13’s exterior section and related stars.
questions: What visual references or emotions guide the outside area design?
How do Kaze and Zeina iterate and give feedback on each other’s work?
What performance safeguards are in place for this open zone?

open_questions.context: Only two of five Yoshi guns are functional.
questions: What unique mechanics does each remaining gun introduce?
Are there technical hurdles delaying their implementation?
How will they be balanced within level design?

open_questions.context: Kaze plans a Course 1-only demo to showcase new controls.
questions: What is the target release window?
How will community feedback be gathered and prioritised?
Will demo feedback feed directly into Return to Yoshi’s Island or broader engine changes?

open_questions.context: Kaze needs more income after the birth of his child and plans more videos.
questions: How will increased video production affect game development time?
Is sponsorship or crowdfunding on the table?
Has becoming a parent influenced your creative direction or work schedule?
